comments: I took this class this fall as a hybrid class! Profesora Holter is extremely kind, you must do a few presentations and 1 fun country project, but she grades easy and just wants to see you put forth effort! You MUST study the book for the quizzes and tests, but they aren\'t hard at all! Try your best and you will get the grade you want for sure!!!

comments: I loved Span101 bcus of her & I\'m not a native speaker! Her classes are fun bcus she makes us learn by playing games most class period. Projects were an easy A and the tests aren\'t hard if you do your homework( which isn\'t hard) and actually participate in class. She also lets you do as much extra credit as you want. DONT TAKE ANYONE ELSE !

tag_professor: Caring (8)  GROUP PROJECTS (6)  EXTRA CREDIT (5)  Respected (4)  Gives good feedback (4)  Amazing lectures (4)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (3)  Clear grading criteria (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Get ready to read (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: She is such an amazing person. I\'m a native speaker so the class obviously would be a cake walk for me but I can see where new comers it would be a little difficult. It wasn\'t boring for me I actually cleared up some things I wasn\'t sure about and learning how to write it. She\'s fun and interesting, there\'s a lot of participating. There is one big group project but it\'s not difficult. Overall I had a great time the homework wasn\'t too hard and I would take her again if she taught the more advanced Spanish classes!

comments: A spectacular professor very much invested in the success of her students. Any language class is going to be tough but she makes it as stress free as possible. Gives lots of opportunities for extra credit. Would strongly recommend her.

comments: Professor Holter was the best Spanish teacher I\'ve taken including high school. I had taken two years of from Spanish and never felt intimidated by this class. You will do lots of group activities but they help you learn. She gives study guides for her exams and if you do the online HW and study the class is a breeze! Gracias Profesora Holter!

comments: To get an A you must study vocabulary and practice the conjugation rules. She is very positive and gives you quizzes with no trick questions. She also introduces you to the culture. She is not hard but you need to pay attention in class, and do the homework. You can definitely get an A if you do that.

comments: I waited 15 months to take the Spanish again; to my surprise I had an amazing experience. The teacher kept the class engaged by applying various technics that worked for different types of learners. The class is not easy, however, if you follow her guidelines, you are on the path to success, especially if you never learned Spanish before.
